location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 2450 of 1850 from Henry Goldsmid, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter concerns slave trade treaties in the Persian Gulf region. The letter encloses an extract taken from a letter from the East India Company Agent at Muscat, dated 4 May 1849, and two extracts from a despatch from the Honorable Court of Directors of the East India Company, dated 27 March 1850, on the subject of the slave trade. All three extracts refer to the lack of observance being given to the slave trade agreement in place between the British Government and the Imam of Muscat and his subjects.
